form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Blackburn (for herself, Mr. Budd, and Mr. Ricketts) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To establish the United States Investment Accelerator, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Investment Accelerator Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate; and
the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives.

paragraph.text: The term Department means the Department of Commerce.
The term Executive Director means the Executive Director of the Investment Accelerator appointed under section 3(c).
The term Investment Accelerator means the United States Investment Accelerator established under section 3(a).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Commerce.

subsection.text: Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary, in coordination with the Secretary of the Treasury and the Assistant to the President for Economic Policy, shall maintain in the Department an office that shall be known as the United States Investment Accelerator.
The purposes of the Investment Accelerator shall be to—

paragraph.text: facilitate and accelerate investments valued at more than $1,000,000,000 in the United States by assisting investors in navigating United States Government regulatory processes efficiently;
reduce regulatory burdens where consistent with applicable law;
increase access to and use of the national resources of the United States where appropriate and consistent with applicable law;
facilitate research collaborations with national labs in the United States;
work with State governments in all 50 States to reduce regulatory barriers to, and increase, domestic and foreign investment in the United States;
coordinate and oversee the activities of the CHIPS Program Office in the Department; and
identify any existing mechanisms, exceptions, and opportunities in Federal law that can be used to assist foreign and domestic investors, consistent with the protection of national security.
There is established the position of the Executive Director of the Investment Accelerator as the head of the Investment Accelerator.
The Executive Director shall be appointed by the Secretary.
The Executive Director shall carry out the purposes of the Investment Accelerator under subsection (b).

subsection.text: The Director may hire legal, transactional, operational, and support staff to support the activities of the Investment Accelerator.

section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and each year thereafter, the Executive Director shall submit a report to the appropriate congressional committees on the activities of the Investment Accelerator.
